column4: Hi, my gnome panels are behaving irratically, I have my lower gnome panel set to autohide, but sometimes (randomly, I am not sure what causes it), it just comes up and stays there, although the system behaves like the panel is in hiding, so mouse clicks even on the panel are actually going behind to the browser! it is really confusing, can anyone throw some light on this ?
anyone on gnome panel ?
how often  does it happen ?
well the only way I know how to fix it is to restart the system...i've experienced this at least 5 times since yesterday
and my system is on almost 24 hours
what i've noticed now is that I can click on the panel if I go to extreme bottom of the screen over the panel....
ok can you access the property's from there
yes
I can deselect autohide
ok do that
I did...but I like it as autohiden...it gives me more screen area to use
then re-enable
I did but it doesn't fix it
what I did now is click on show hide bottons, that is working ok though
ok sometimes its a  fix!
did that fix the problem
oh, well I clicked on show hide buttons, showed / hide the panel a few times, then reverted to autohide, it seems to have been fixed now
it did fix it, but do you know what causes it ?
well all i can say is its a bug that affects my laptop . must be a bug ! that works for me too
hmm ok well the fix is better than restart though :)
well all i can say is its a bug that affects my laptop . must be a bug ! that works for me to
yeah  i know good luck!
